result.execSummary:
The defendant Latherio Meadows was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharges, costs and disbursements.  Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balane to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendasnt.
-Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Tyrone W., Angela W., Dawn A. or their residence.
No ocontrolled substances  or alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN STEPHANIE P.O.BOX 36 WINNEBAGO WI 54985-0036

It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7 Judge McAdams
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Certification of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING transcript commencing 07/22/2015 received and filed. (35 Pages.) CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Latherio Meadows not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Case continued before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Latherio Meadows not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Court granted defense request and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Latherio Meadows in court with attorney Nathan Opland Dobs for Michael Jude.  Defendant Latherio Meadows in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Shorts-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

CASE RECALLED.  SAME APPEARANCES.
COURT ORDERED DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TYRONE AND ANGELA W., OR THEIR RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Latherio Meadows in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Latherio Meadows in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
